name: fossilizing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
fossilize
[ I or T ] to become or to make something become a fossil (= something preserved in rock for a very long period): The remains gradually fossilized. Lava buried the forest, eventually fossilizing the trees.
[ I ] to fail to change even after becoming old-fashioned: After he died we continued to follow his methods, and the organization fossilized. Our concepts can sometimes fossilize as we get older.
More examplesFewer examplesOnly bones and hard areas fossilize.The birds' bones are very fragile and tend to break down before they fossilize.a fossilizing process in which wood is gradually replaced by silica
